review_content:
중국 최초의 현대식 맥주인 하얼빈(HARBIN) 입니다.

1900년부터 시작된 The Earliest Beer Brewed In China라고 캔에 기재된 내용으로도 알 수 있죠.

한때는 중국 판매량 1등도 하던 3대장이었지만 지금은 최초라는 타이틀이 무색할만큼 설화, 칭따오, 옌징에 밀려 중국 4대 맥주라 불리고 있네요.

그러나 말이 4등이지 엄청난 내수 시장으로 세계랭크로 쳐도 단일제품 판매량 7위인 세계적인(?) 맥주입니다. 참고로 세계 1위는 설화, 2위는 미국의 버드와이저, 3위는 칭다오, 8위는 옌징이구요.

하얼빈 맥주는 칭따오와 마찬가지로 제국주의 식민지맛 맥주에요. 칭따오가 독일이 만들었다면 하얼빈은 러시아가 만들었죠.

당시 시베리아횡단철도를 완공한 러시아는 제국의 위용을 과시하며 남하 정책으로 철도를 내리 꽃는데 중국과의 국경 때문에 돌아가야했던 블라디보스토크 노선을 직선으로 뚫어버릴 계획을 합니다. 더불어 남쪽으로 내려가기에도 하얼빈은 너무나 좋은 위치였구요.

공사가 진행되며 수많은 인구가 유입되었고 역시 술은 참을 수 없습니다. 그렇게 만들어진게 바로 하얼빈1900 인 것.

러시아의 양조 기술에 개성이 없었던 것인지, 당시 맥주의 유행이 라거였기에 그런 것인지, 중국 현지 음식이 전반적으로 짜고 기름져서 그런 것인지, 노동 후에 시원하게 마시기 위한 술이라 그런 것인지 모르겠으나

상당히 깔끔하고 청량한 맛이 특징이에요. 쌀이 들어가서 그런 부드러움이 더 두드러지는데 탄산보리차라 해야할까 그 뿐입니다.

잔에 따를때도 입에 가득담을때도 보리의 비린내 말고는 아무 향이 없을 정도인데 홉을 맥주에 주요 포인트로 보는 관점에선 너무 재미가 없네요.

같이 마신 분은 한국 맥주보다 맛이 없답니다. 정확히 말해선 한국 대기업 맥주말이지요. 최소 점수가 1점도 못 주겠는데..
A drinkable mass market lager, nothing fancy, nevertheless something nice to down with a couple of barbecue skewers.
Can.  Pale yellow.  Ceral forward malt profile with that light euro-lagerish tint.  Pretty standard pale lager, which ain;t sayin much.

Хорошее, утоляющее жажду пиво и гасящее жар от острой китайской кухни. По крайней мере лучше светлого Spaten или мерзкого Warsteiner. Не очень горькое, не кислое, в меру сладкое. Беру его всегда. И в Китае его тоже всегда пью. Рекомендую
500ml bottle from Sainsbury’s, Watford and drunk on 14/04/2007.  Very bog standard pale lager, with slight cereal notes.
Can@Shanghai airport. A truly disgusting experience. Certainly one of the worst beers I have ever tried, and quite possibly the worst.
Aromat mokrego chleba. Praktycznie woda, niewiele poza tym. Goryczki w zasadzie brak.

Dose in Flughafen Shanghai
Sehr klares gelb, fast kein Schaum, durchschnittliche Kohlensäure.
Klassisches Pale Lager Aroma Hopfen, etwas Zitrus. Etwas künstlich.
Kein wirklicher Geschmack zu Beginn, dann macht sich etwas Getreide im Rachen breit. Ansonsten Hopfen aber keine Bitterness. Auch nicht sonderlich (Malz)süß. Etwas Jasmin. Wenn es etwas steht eine normale Pampe, die man Schell wieder vergisst

Just don't get your hopes up. It's a light lager from China. Of course it's going to taste like metal, corn and water - it's supposed to. Unfortunately, despite feeling refreshing at first, the aftertaste is too unpleasant for even my liking.
One of the worst beers I’ve ever had. Just tastes like the let corn rot in some water and let it ferment. Not worth the calories. Not even close

From my wife because I hadn't rated it yet: pours ugly with a head that leaves piss water. Macro grainy corn nose. Taste is Sweet and grainy and watery. I was expecting this to be worse from the nose and the like.
Typical macro style lager. Extremely light, very little hop or aroma. Did appreciate the mild malting, but overall was a tad sweet and had a corn like aftertaste.

610ml bottle
Pale straw with white head.
Grainy/rice aroma.
Thin grainy palate.
Обычный лагер - для жары и острой китайской пищи. Нет ничего запоминающегося.
Undrinkable. Even bad for an airport beer. Had it at China Air lounge in Shanghai.
중국 최초의 현대식 맥주인 하얼빈(HARBIN) 입니다. 1900년부터 시작된 The Earliest Beer Brewed In China라고 캔에 기재된 내용으로도 알…

Can@Shanghai airport. A truly disgusting experience. Certainly one of the worst beers I have ever tried, and quite possibly the worst.
Aromat mokrego chleba. Praktycznie woda, niewiele poza tym. Goryczki w zasadzie brak.
Dose in Flughafen Shanghai Sehr klares gelb, fast kein Schaum, durchschnittliche Kohlensäure. Klassisches Pale Lager Aroma Hopfen, etwas Zitrus. Etwas künstlich.…

Just don't get your hopes up. It's a light lager from China. Of course it's going to taste like metal, corn and water - it's supposed to. Unfortunately, despite feeling refreshing at first, the aftertaste is too unpleasant for even my liking.
One of the worst beers I’ve ever had. Just tastes like the let corn rot in some water and let it ferment. Not worth the calories. Not even close

From my wife because I hadn't rated it yet: pours ugly with a head that leaves piss water. Macro grainy corn nose. Taste is Sweet and grainy and watery. I was expecting this to be worse from the nose and the like.
Typical macro style lager. Extremely light, very little hop or aroma. Did appreciate the mild malting, but overall was a tad sweet and had a corn like aftertaste.
610ml bottle Pale straw with white…
Обычный лагер - для жары и острой китайской пищи. Нет ничего запоминающегося.
Undrinkable. Even bad for an airport beer. Had it at China Air lounge in Shanghai.
Bottle. Clear gold pouring. Decent head. Clean grainy aroma & taste. Low bitterness. Drinkable.

Canned. Thx anonymous
Pale yellow with almost no head. 
Light cereal aroma. 
Sweetand cereal flavour. Sugary. 
Absolutely no bitterness. High carbonation.
Bottle. Pale Gold. Light, mild, slightly sweet, lightly malted lager. Not particularly exciting, but it is drinkable. (2008)
Burk i Changchun. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Besksöt doft med brödtoner. Mjölkig munkänsla med mycket brödsmulor och lite citrus.
Backlog. 610 ml bottle had with food in Singapore. Inauspicious macro lager. Some corn, rice.
Well it’s not bad for the style at least. Inoffensive and refreshing...........light flavors of corn, some malt and maybe a hint of wheat.
Dåse. Hotelværelse i Geyongdo. Hvad man kan forvente af kedelig makro lager. En del hvede i smagen men ellers kedelig. Mest interessante var den gamle måde at åbne dåsen på.
Canned. Lots of wheat taste. Very thin with a semi sweet aftertaste that turns to bitter. Okay.
Average pils beer, golden color and light taste, light on alcohol as well. Quite bubbly and goes down very well.

Bottle 0.33l at Dva Stapica Chinese Fast Food place Belgrade Serbia. 17.11.2015.Pour it clear golden color with small white head.Aroma corn.Taste malt, sourish corn, maybe also rice inside, not good quality.

Some people might claim that this beer is thin and watery, with a strong taste of either nothing, or of rice and corn. It’s pale, it’s thin, it has very little hop, and i LOVE it. It works really well with simple Chinese food like congee and preserved radish. Maybe not what I would serve with peking duck, maybe not what i would serve with kung pao chicken, but with simple hainan steamed chicken it is perfect.
Very pale gold with nearly not head in its traditional China’s bowl. Sweet aroma and taste. Rice, light hops. Better than average Chinese beers.

600ml Bottle in Macau as Harbin NBA, 5%

Sweetish malty beginning. Strange chemical aroma, smooth but no depth. No bitterness on a neutral sweetish body. Boring.

I though it had a promising start then it turned out to be neither one thing or another, aside from cold. Bit of hops not enough, malt aroma, but not enough in the body, bit empty really. But it quenched a thirst.
Had this at a team business dinner on my first trip to China (Shanghai). Basic pale lager. Nothing special but it tasted just great as the team cheers’d me one by one!
Bottle at mission hills, haikou. Light golden color. Aroma is malty. Taste is malty lager, not good.
Easy drinking session beer, nothing special, pours a light yellow with a small diminishing white head, earthy grainy aroma, what you would expect for a Chinese Lager refreshing but only just.

12oz can. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Standard lager but I enjoyed it less than most other lagers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bright yellow appearance, medium low head. Malty and grainy aromas, sweet, not much hops or bitterness. Average Pale lager style.
Extremely poor beer. Kind of taste like a shitty lager and tea infused with it. Very odd one. Don’t like it at all

Bottle: pours a light yellowish straw color with quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is almost non-existent, maybe a slight malty sweetness. Taste is very light, slightly grainy, and sweet. There really is no hop presence detectable, as it finishes with a light sugary flavor on the tongue. Carbonation is relatively high, body is very light. Really gives the meaning in the phrase "Beer is really just slightly contaminated water."

ours yellow with a thin white head that’s gone in seconds. Nose is a sticky kind of sweet graininess. Taste is not particularly pleasant; slightly medicinal and bland. Thin, watery, average carbonation. Not much. Perhaps better than Miller Lite.

Pours yellow with a thin white head that's gone in seconds. Nose is a sticky kind of sweet graininess. Taste is not particularly pleasant; slightly medicinal and bland. Thin, watery, average carbonation. Not much. Perhaps better than Miller Lite.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml can from The Beer Store. Pours a clear pale golden colour with near instantly disappearing white head. Aroma is sweet grains with light adjunct. Flavour likewise. Thin-medium body. Weak but there are worse pale lagers out there.

Miami Heat / NBA. I cannot relate this to Harbin, but that’s what was on the can, from a HK grocery store. Not surprisingly, a sweet, flavourless uneventful pale lager, with only a flourish bite to mention. From the description above, than I’d say it was Russian, before becoming Chinese.
500 ml bottle pours light golden with zero head and light carbonation. Not much aroma or taste.

Fizzy golden yellow, foam not worth mentioning. I’m always alarmed at how bright some pale lagers can be. Anyway, taste is corn syrup, barley. Not much finish. Sweetish. Crisp, clean etc. Not offensive.
500ml can with a pull tab. 4.3% abv. Pale yellow, almost no head. Weak nose, some sweet grain. Taste has grain and straw. Drying and plain finish. Light body, fizzy. Bland brew, industrial swill.

(Part 2 of a 2-part “Macro Abyss Night” mini series, 1-Jun-2013)



600 ml clear bottle as “Harbin Bing Chun (Ice Pure)” at abv 5%. Having this with a group of friends during a raucous dinner / gathering at a famous Tai Pai Dong-style restaurant somewhere in North Point.



Pours an ugly urine amber yellow color onto Harbin-logo rice bowl; Razor-thin head and residual white foam which last for about 20 seconds;
Zero lacing and near zero carbonation; Low sweet smell of faint malt, rice and apple; Very light sweet taste of malt notes, sweet apple, and faint rice; Light body, watery palate; Mouth feel is beer-water at its finest, pretty much devoid of any taste except some apple sweetness and slight hint of rice. No other foul taste is detected; Hoppiness is zero on all fronts. No finish. Wet after taste, extremely easy to mouth.



Comments: I thought this one would be really bad, considering the clear bottle and my previous bad experience with restaurant-bound Chinese macros like Tsingtao 10°. It turned out just fine, because it’s a beer-water with no skunk, almost no smell and taste, just a horrid bowl of urine-like liquid with some sweetish apple nose and barely some taste. My friends, freed from an all-afternoon mock exam, were so receptive of this and we ended up having 10 bottles without any signs of getting knocked. That’s Harbin flagship beer for you, folks. One of our friends brought along a bottle of Chocolat Rouge Sweet Red wine, with a nice sweet milk chocolate taste and palate reminiscent of Young’s Double Chocolate Stout, was the focus of the night. Go figure.
Usual pale ale/ lager colour and flavour.  Nothing new or exciting.  Seemed well made.  Was not off putting and did its job with some spicy dumplings.
Gul i färgen, vitt skum. Doftar och smakar malt, gräs, hö, ris, papper. En ok öl för att vara Kina.

500 ml can, Harbin 1900 Treasure, ’The Oldest Beer Brewed in China’ 4.3%
Clear bright yellow, feeble foamy white head vanishes instantly. Slightly skunky corny grainy sweet Asian lager malt taste. Lively carbonation, light bodied, low hopped. Okay for what it is... Chinese industrial swill. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
Very little to notice about this beer besides it’s sparkling clear. Tastes thin and watery with a cereal taste. Found everywhere in the country especially at Hot Pot restaurants.
Slightly malty sweet aroma and flavour. No bitterness. Clear golden colour. Boring.
Man is this beer boring...almost clear....barely yellow....some grain aromas and flavours....boring and unimpressive.

Same as every other china beer, water crap with no taste. Has some rusty notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at a hawker stall in Hong Kong. A pretty piss poor pale lager that is even worse than Corona in the tasteless stakes.with faint sweetcorn flavours /aromas and a neglible hop presence. Weak watery texture.
yellow with minimal head. slightly skunky generic lager. didn’t notice that this bottle is nearly 3 years old when I bought it, so that’s on me.

I drank Harbin while I had lamb steak for dinner and I did not like this. I guess Harbin would get along with some Chinese food, but the beer itself is not very tasty. I felt like it contained some impurities which shadow the pure beer’s flavor.

Green 600ml bottle, no sock type wrappings for us Brits, plus the ABV is only 4.8% according to my bottle. 

It was not until I got the bottle home that I read the small print and discovered the beer is distributd in Europe by AB. 

I have been cutting my grass and it is still warm and sunny, which is very unusual for England, so I am now on the patio and about to open the beer, it is best before 22 Feb 2008, it is going to be drank on a Sunday in May 2007. 

I have Leerdamer, a strong chedder, some radishes cut up and a bowl of lemon flavoured green olives to have as I review (I won’t eat anything until I am half way though the beer). 

Poured into my Hoegaarden Grand Cru glass, it looks OK, clear, golden light yellow, with a good white head. 

The aroma is very Italian lager, not a lot to smell, but there is that half beery, yeasty, hoppy hint that lets you know there is some alcohol in the liquid. 

The taste is also Southern European, again not a lot of flavours, it is softer than a German Pilsner, nothing to get excited about, but no unpleasant either. 

Because there isn’t much going on, there is very little mouthfeel, no body to cling in your mouth, no huge alcohol kick that lingers, just a drink that has made me burp! 

This is a beach holiday beer. In an already saturated Lager market (in the UK), this is not strong enough in any department to make an impact. This review is now over, I am looking forward to having the cheese and stuff with the second half of the bottle, it might enhance the beers good points and bring out some extra flavours. 

PS. It didn’t.

Small offwhite coarseish head doesn’t last. Clear yellow body. Light malt and nice aroma. Dryish mealy malty taste with faint sugary notes. Mid-bodied. Faintly sharp mouthfeel. Dryish rice candy (dango) aftertaste with malty notes. Incredibly bland, but inoffensive. (0.6l bottle, Wellcome, Lohas Park, Hong Kong. 5%, according to label.)
Bottle.  Pours light gold with a slight haze.  Average white head.  Aroma of malt and grain.  Taste is malt, corn, and grass. A bit sweet.  Ugh.

500ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a finger of white head that settles down and leaves only spotted lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light grains and faint hops.  There are more hops in the taste and nicely balanced with a light malty sweetness.  Light bodied and decent carbonation.  A pretty good beer for the style.

600ml bottle.
Pale straw, white head.
Extremely neutral aromas, faint citrus, a whiff of cardboard.
Dry, light bodied, low bitterness, balanced CO2.
Neutral taste, rice, cardboard, citrus. (2012-01-03)

Bouteille claire de 500 ml apportée de Chine par mon père. Arôme: Très légère odeur de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est blonde très pâle avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence d’un mince col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Très léger goût de céréales avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est mince avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrièr goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #3
635)
Bottle from Morrisons Supermarket. Pours very light yellow, not much of a head. In fact not much carbonation. Flat light and weak tasting lager.
Bottled Chinese sewer water, beware, smell of farts, taste of water/bile. Ewie.

11th August 2007 
 Warning! Early amateur rating! Moderate carbonation. Tasteless lager - insipid and dry. Bleh!
The Chinese attempt at making a Pale Lager. Tsingtao didn’t get it right, so maybe Harbin can. Clever labeling.
Light straw/gold color; Medium body; Aroma of malt, some hops, & subtle fruit; Flavor of malt, light hops, some grain; Fairly bland; Overall, it was decent.

Harbin Brewing Company, Limited, Wuhan, Heilongjiang, China--Harbin Lager--2007 11.2 oz. Green Bottle.  5.40% ABV.  20 IBU’s?  (4.0 / 5.0	Pale Lager.  Clear bright gold color.  Foamy lacy white head.  Mild Pils hop front.  Crisp tangy malty smooth butter caramel mild sweet body.  Tangy clean crisp spicy hop end.  Real Lager from China!  Sampled 2/23/2007.

Harbin Brewing Company, Limited, Wuhan, Heilongjiang, China--Harbin Lager--2007 20.3 oz. Green bottle.  5.40% ABV.  20 IBU’s?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Pale Lager.  Foamy lacy white head.  Clear bright gold color.  Mild tangy hop malt front.  Mild sweet creamy mild butter caramel all malt smooth lager body.  No stank.  Clean balanced hop spice satisfying end.  Sampled 2/24/2007.

I think this one is a bit underrated.  Sure, there’s nothing particularly interesting about it, but it’s a solid, well-balanced light lager with a decent amount of flavor.  Pours medium gold, aroma of pale malt, whiff of hops.  Taste is slight sweetness nicely balanced with a touch of bitterness.  Clear, slightly crisp finish.  Refreshing, basic.

Bottle, as Harbin Lager. It’s a clear, golden beer with a small white head. Fruity nose with some hops. A chemical whiff too. Pretty uninteresting flavor, low on both malts and hops, but far from awful. Fruits and hints of bittering hops both initially and in the end. Medium to thin on the palate. A drinkable one, but definately not a favorite. 091223
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is malt, grass. Flavour is sweet, hop, malt, grass. Boring beer.
5/10/10.  12oz bottle into a pint glass.  Yay skunky green bullshit!  You don’t deserve to be rated, you crappy crap.  Bleeeeeh.  Skunk, corn, grass, hay, all that common stuff.  No thanks.
Well, this looks like a lager, or Ginger Ale maybe. Scent is musky. Taste is colored water......guess I just have had ginger ale......
Purchased at Total Wine. Pale golden pour from a green bottle. Aroma of mild grass. Rice taste and garbage.  This.
Strong, urine scent with a typical pale yellow color.  Pour comes out with a medium white head.  Thin body, not much to the taste.  Waste of my time.
Ummm ones across the board... do I need to put anything here?  Actually, I do just to fill enough space to make an entry.
Had in Harbin some years back. Watery, corn, rice, little in the way of aroma. Was drank frequently under a tent while smoking a cheap Chinese cigar. Good for memories, not good for imbibing.

Bottle @ pre-GBBF shindig, August 2009. Pleasant pale gold appearance. Lively carbonation. Clean enough. There is a slight adjunct edge but it doesn’t overwhelm the pale malt. An innocuous but not unpalatable pale lager.
Pours the typical lager yellow color with a medium white head.  Fruity, hoppy nose.  Taste very similar to smell, medium carbonation and a very light bodied beer.  Decent.
Pretty respectable.  Drinkable and reasonably fresh with some definite hop apparent in it too.  Not too bad

Bottle shared by Tmoney99.  Pours a slightly hazy pale golden color with an averaged sized white head.  Aromas of grains, corn, grassy with a touch of sweetness.  Tastes of some malty sweetness, corn and grainy. There was the slightest sake characteristic. Thin body.  Worth a try once.
Thin head but good carbonation light gold coloured beer aroma grainy flavour grainy strong rice presence rather bland taste weak bitter put it simply salty rice water terrible stuff.

Bottle 600ml.
Clear light to medium yellow orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, corn, toasted, fruity, grass. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average duration. Body is light medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20090802]

600ml botte from morrisons. Sweet corny lagery malt nose. straw colour with a faint resemblance of a head that quickly disappeared. quite refreshing in a metallic, sweet sense. nothing spectacular but went well with liver dumplings in caper sauce... if thats a recommendation is another thing...
12 ounce bottle at the Pei Wei Restaurant Pembroke Pines, FL 9/28/09 Nothing special.
Golden with a small white head. Weak aroma of malt and herbal hops. Sweet and malty flavour.
thin golden lager with a thin white head. little bit sweet. little watery. Taste alittle bit like rice... taste kindof grassy. Not bad... not great. Luckily mine is very cold
Pale yellow, soft white foam.  Aroma is corn, sweet cereal.  Taste is sweet corn, metallic finish.
Deep golden colour, very thin white head. The nose is dominated by grainy adjuncts, this is also found on the palate. The finish is quite sweet....a bog standard mass produced style of lager.

As soon as i open it up and take a smell i can see right away why it rates so low. The color is a clear gold with a mild malty smell and a thin white head. The flavor is a bit bland and watery and has no hop flavor at all. Overall it is not good and could use improvement, like more hop flavor.
Bottled. A pale yellow beer with a white head. Rice aroma. Horrible tAste of cooked vegetables. Watery
Bottled. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is maize, rice, hops and some notes of grass. Flavour is sweet malts, some grains and mild notes of rubber.
Clear pale gold-yellow with a thin wispy white head. Sweet fruit and skunk grain aroma. Taste is crisp grain and sweet apple with corn. A bitter funky finish, thin body, high carbonation.

Standard yellow colored with vanishing head. Aroma is weird with some spiciness in it, also some dry papery tone is present. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is similar with interesting Belgian spiciness in it, otherwise dull flavored with thin lemon.
Poured clear golden yellow, clean, crisp, malt, grainy, little hops, little corn, little light fruits.
Bottle. pours a golden yellow with a thick white head. Aroma is skunk and grains. Taste of watered down malt, finishes with a hint of metallic.

(bottle - 330 ml) Clear yellow with a fizzy and soapy white head. Aroma is lightly skunked with some faint sweetness in the aroma. Stale hops as well. Flavor is dry and grainy at the beginning with some stale hops and a very light malt note. Crisp finish.

Bottle.  Faint yellow colored body. White head clings around the edges of the liquid. The stench of recently dead skunk greets my nose, making me fear the upcoming sip. Sweet, honey malt taste with lots of metallic overtones and a hint of skunk.

Bottle shared with DuffmanSW.  Pours a crystal clear yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is grassy with a hint of citrus, skunky and metallic.  Flavor is bread and rice, slightly tart.  Pretty watery, not much there at all. Palate is thin and it’s fizzy and overcarbonated.  This beer is not very good.

Another from Mspindler.. Pours a clear yellow with a fluffy white head.. Smells grassy like a heineken.. Bready tasting.. I told Mike it left an after taste like I just had some shrimp fried rice.. Might switch to this when I go get some sushi.
Bleh. Fizzy but no head. Cardboard flavors. I like an occasional light lager in this style, but not this one.
Bottle, Zeke’s. Clear dark gold with hardly any head. Sweet but clean aromas are not bad at all. Medium carbonation, quaffable. Sweet malts carry some fruitiness into the refreshing palate. Decent.

Yellow and kind of dirty lookin but clear. Smells like rice grain and malt. Not a whole lot there other than a slight skunkiness.Tastes of barley and rice and nothing more. I really dont have anything else to add.Clean and kind of crisp which is all the good I can say.

Ha!  Call it Harbin, brew it in Wuhan.  Inspired by the culture of Heilongjiang...yes I can taste the ice and snow sculpture festival right now.  I can see it in the dull yellow colour and smell it in the generic eurohop nose.  Sweetish, clean with saazy accents and straw malts.  Way too much flavour to be inspired by Chinese brewing culture.

Pours a pale, golden color with a white head.  Aroma is of grain, earthy hops, and a slight citrus aroma.  More flavor then I was expecting but not much.  Grainy, floral hops, and a hint of citrus.  Crisp finish.  A little better than I expected.
surprising flavor from one of the clearist beers ive ever seen, if your from the states, your probably just giving it a try, and its worth it, but only once.

2008 Bottle - Pours a lt orange with a large off-white head...aroma is grassy malt, corn and lager skunk...flavour isn’t bad...there isn’t much to it, but it isn’t bad...sweet grainy malt, light citrus and hop bitters, heavy carbonation...probably the least offensive beer I’ve had from AB...

Received as a present from a non-beer geek friend. 

Big fluffy head clear golden. Smells of grass, bread and rice. A bit like the opening of a rice cooker. Mostly grain flavor that drinks down easily.
Bottle. Pours a golden color with the very littlest of white heads. Aroma is corn, malts, and grains. Flavor is sweet malts and corn. Body is kind of watery but an ok drink
Nice packaging. Big soapy white head, light golden pour. Notes of corn, wheat, salt sweat, and bread. Not the worse but disgusting when it gets warm.
Poured at the Gulfstream beer fest.  Good lord why is this crap even brewed.  Barely(and I mean barely)better than a bud.  It smells and tastes weird.  Very weird.  Yuck.

Bottle. Poured golden with a tall fizzy white head that loudly settles to nothing. Aromas of grass, bamboo, grain, and rice. The flavor is mainly grain with some faint citrus. Light body and tingly carbonation. Ehh...

Pours very pale gold with a 1 finger fuzzy white head that recedes to a skim after a minute or two. Aroma is sweet malt, adjunct and grassy hops. Flavor is really weak, sweet malt, corn, a little mineraly, slightly grassy finish. Body is much too thick and oily for the style or it’s profile, kinda strange, in a bad way.

poale clear gold, medium white quickly dissipating head, slight lace.  nose of mild rice, corn.  not much flavor, maybe a hint of malt, but just a hint.  light bodied, mild, mild bitter finish.  so inoffensive it is hardly there at all.   bottle purchased at the st. louis anheuser-busch brewery gift shop.
Well I cannot really say that I expected too much.  Smell is not good.  Looked ok at first but faded at the end.

600ml bottle.  Pours a transparent orange-yellow color.  Lots of carbonation bubbles, not unlike a soda.  Adjunct laced aroma, pretty unpleasant, I guess that would be the rice.  Sugary sweet with some rice character.  Not horrible, or as undesirable as the aroma, remains drinkable at least. Hellongjiang isn’t beer country.
Pours golden with a white head. Flavor is sweet malt, rice, and a decent bit of hop bitterness.

12 ounce Bottle from the A-B Colorado Brewery.  Pours a golden yellow with a thin white head.  Taste is of corn, grain, some rice and some malt.  Is a little sweet and is somewhat thin.  Similar aroma.  Easy to drink and unoffensive.  Not too bad, but I was expecting more.

A Mes rate. Yet another shower of bottled shite to avoid cocktails. Maybe I should have ordered a Mojito... Pale gold with an oily film topping. Very corny, slightly sticky. Dull as hell. No flavour. Arse.

Canned from a supermarket in Shenzhen, China. Light golden coloured, medium white head. Grainy nose. Very weak flavour, little bitterness, but no annoying sweetness. General lack of flavour, but that’s what one can expect from Anheuser-Busch...

Harbin Beer is a very clear and sparkling light golden lager.  The soft white head fades quickly.  It has a funky aroma, like vegetables, melon, alcohol and rotten fruit.  It has a medium-light body that’s pretty smooth, with a reasonably crisp finish.  It has a fusel flavor.  It burns my nose.  There is, perhaps, a note of citrus.  It was a challenge to finish this beer.  It comes in a fancy bottle, though!

This beer is a clear straw color with with a short white head that dissipates quickly. Spotty lacing. Mild hops aroma with vegetables and malt in the background. Light body with light sweet malt and grassy hops flavors. The finish is mildly bitter hops with a short sweet malt aftertaste. Nothing redeeming about this beer, it makes Tsingtao interesting by comparison.
The nicely wrapped bottle was what made me buy it. Light aroma, medium-dark yellow colour, small disappearing head, not a strong taste with hints of a wheaty flavour. Nothing special but not bad.
Gold color with a thin head.  Aroma of rice, dusted with moldy hops.  Corny taste, finishing with a drop of skunk.  Not nearly as bad as I was expecting.
Standard gold color with a fizzy white head.  Aroma and flavor of malt and grain.  Thin palate.  Nothing much going on with this.

We just recently got this on our order pad in Morrisons Fleet so of course I had to order some in. Today I put them on the shelf and of course bought one for myself so I can tell customers about it (Good Excuse).

The look of the bottle apealed to me straight away as it’s very eye catching. The tast is not as strong as you thought it would be which is very suprising. First taste of it I wasn’t to sure but a few mouthfuls and im impressed by it. I wouldn’t class it as a regular drink but if I saw it out in a pub then this would be one of those I would drink.

Price was about around about £1.80. This is a drink you would have every so often, not all the time. I would recomended this to any of my customers

12 oz green bottle Harbin Brewing Company - Wuhan China. Clean pale malt aroma with touch of spiciness. Clear yellow/light gold with small white head. Light spiciness and pale malt flavor. Dry finish. Light thin body. Okay light lager.

Just like Tsing Tao, only not as offensive.  No evidence of hops, barley any malt.  Monster head!  No lacing.  Grassy taste like Tsing Tao.  Skip or run past it, just like a homeless person begging for change, if you stop they got you.

12oz bottle. this is the worst piece of shit i’ve ever tasted from Asia. Tsing Tao is not too good, but this is like Tibetan yak piss.
i’ll take Tsing Tao over this any day.

Clear golden coloured body with a super-thin white head. Aroma of fresh malt and a tiny bit of hops, coupled with a metallic scent. Medium-bodied; Fresh malt in the taste with a little fruity tang and nuttiness. Aftertaste shows a little more complexity with a bit of alcohol, strong malt and good clear low a.a. hops. Overall, not a horrible beer - much cleaner than Tsingtao, with some decent flavours compared to other chinese beers. I sampled this 600 mL wrapped bottle from Ping/Charlie Chiang’s in Arlington (Shirlington) during the 2008 Opening Ceremony to the Olympics on 08.August.2008.

Pale golden skunky smelling brew.  I still can’t figure out why brewers go to all the trouble of brewing beer and use Green bottles.  I guess they think their drinkers like skunks.  I’m glad I only bought one (1) bottle.
This isn’t horrible considering.  Tastes like a lot of other beer from China.  Has that same buttery maltiness, dry and bitter, slightly overcarbonated, but remains clean.

12oz Bottle @ Navy Pier beer garden, surprised they had something I had not had before, It still sucked. Thin foamy head on a straw body. Nose-usual pale lager nose-stale hops, light skunk, dust. Taste-corn, water from a can of canned kernel corn, light lactic sourness, medium CO2, thin, light lotion. Not a great Pale Lager, but not a bad one either.
60cl, Morrisons, Inverness.  Golden colour, skunky aroma, malty taste, a bit grassy.  A bit watery also.  Not great.

Taste 7/8 bottle 10/7. Looks: Golden yellow, no head really. Aroma: Skunky, sweet malt, mild piss odor, straw and grain. Taste: Spicy and banana ester at first, then weird body/ palate wash, burns the bottom of the tongue yet bores the top. Strange. Ehhh...not recommended.  Will not purchase again.
Bottle 0.5 l. Pale yellow, corny, hayish hoppy nose. Flavor is very american. Sweet rice/corn flavor with kinda flavorful hops, not exactly bitter tho. Flavorful. Could be worse.

Hmmm... Pours yellow with a head that diminishes quickly. It is slightly carbonated and smells and later tastes a bit skunky. It is smooth though at times, especially when cold. This is a grainy corn like taste that seems to spoil on the tongue. Not a suggested drinker.

Pours pale, straw yellow. Aroma is surprisingly good. Not skunky, which is surprising for a Chinese beer in West Virginia. More crisp. Flavor...not too strong. Not bad though. Kind of bland...although somehow, very drinkable.

Sampled in the BrewMaster’s Club at Busch Gardens Williamsburg on 07/10/2008. Very clear pale yellow body with a small off-white head. Sweet grain and light noble hop aroma. Sweet grain flavor with some more light hop hins. Medium light body with moderate carbonation.

short notes, old tasting. had in bottles in philadelphia. 
too much carb in the body and a pretty standard lager nose/taste.
20.3 oz green bottle-A clear yellow with a loose two finger head. Aroma of sweetness, citrus, and floral. Taste of nothing but sweetness and corn with a floral finish. Better than expected.

a bit fizzy at first this is a brew in the Chinese tradition and that is to say it has a purpose. in all fairness that purpose fits in to the Western style of eating and of course beer drinking quite appropriately. this is a pleasant beer with a decent aroma of fruit. the flavors seem appropriate and real enough. as lagers go it holds it’s own quite nicely in my book. the beer fits in with food in general and for that matter it is to be respected. decent body well balanced refreshing and clean it is enjoyable. it maintains a good beer quality and still has it’s own identity.
bottle, yellow color with faint sweet nose, taste is light hop with decent floral crisp finish

Bottle.  Pour is a golden color with a bit of a white head and aromas that at first are kind of skunky hops and later fade to adjunct malt.  Flavor has a bit of a Heineken feel to it with the hops presence and then gives way to sweet adjunct that bordes on nastiness.

Definitely lacks flavor was very common pours a nice yellow gold there is just nothing to say about it don’t get me wrong it does refresh but there are just better choices for the money i’d grab tsingtao if you want to add china to your list

Green 600 ml bottle: Not much to go on aroma or taste-wise, it’s all so faint. Bright golden yellow body with a creamy white head. The aroma is corn, a trace of sweet malt, and some grass and flowers. The flavor is very light, malt with corn and some grass. Kind of an earthy finish to it.

Not sure why I bought this beer. Perhaps it was the fancy "tissue" wrapped bottle that drew me. But I’ve yet to have a Chinese beer that wasn’t a huge disappointment, and this didn’t do anything to change that string of bad luck. 



The beer pours out a really nice golden hue, with a decent two-finger thick head. Aroma was slightly skunked, some corn and a small bit of grains. Flavor of corn, a bit on the sweet side so it did have a decent malt profile. The soda-water like mouthfeel with it’s over carbonation was also hard to deal with. Not a horrible beer, and it does live up to it’s style points of a pale lager. Just wayyyy overpriced for the little flavor you get.
piss poor raunchy lager.  Probably got lead poisoning now that I think about it.  I new it was made by Matel, I mean Busch.

330mL Bottle: Pours clear gold w/ a nice white head that leaves a bit of tight lacing behind. Aroma is grainy & skunky at first, but after it settles caramel starts to emerge. Flavor is grainy w/ a little sweetness to it, that sweetness does hang around towards the back of the mouth. Also has a slight bitterness, but rather watery. Not very memorable. Actually, I think I had this before I started rating & well here it is again. So, I guess I already did forget it once...

330ml bottle. Clear, golden body. Thin, white lacing-head. Plain grassy aroma. Possesses flavours of soft sweetness and grain. Light bitter endnote. Watered and a bit sticky (at Finn’s, Tromsø 16.05.2008).
Bottle 0,33l. Golden colored. Hardly any head. Sweet malty & metallic aroma. Some metallic flavor. A bit lacking in the aftertaste. KI=3
This lighter bodied  brew is noticeably grainy. pours a golden-orange colour with a pretty weak head. Taste is lighter, sort of chewy, but skunked in aroma.

This Pale Lager pours a medium gold color from a 330ml bottle. Small to medium sized white fizzy head. The aroma is sweet, malt, a touch vegetative with some corn and skunk. A medium to light bodied pale lager. The malts are fruity and sweet touch of corn and some rice. The hops are slightly spicy. A pretty typical tasting pale lager, though not as skunked as most. It is a touch sweet and a little vegetative and mostly beer flavor seltzer water. But it’s not really objectionable. Mouthfeel is a touch thin. Finish is crisp. Aftertaste is slightly sweet with a touch of cardboard.

[330ml bottle from Tesco’s] My bottle was only 4.7% - I get the impression this varies in different countries?  Weak, watery, no flavour other than a mild but thoroughly unpleasant lingering sourness in the aftertaste. Quite the worst beer I’ve ever had.  Are A-B simply distributing this to make their Budweiser taste good in comparison?

12oz green bottle: Standard gold pour with a sizeable white head that settles, but never leaves.  Grassy nose that displays all the classic signs of green bottle lager.  I’ve actually come to except this fact and compared to other green bottle beers, this one isn’t half bad.  The grassiness is at least defined and somewhat clean, with a soft buttery caramel malt in the background.  The body starts watery, but fills out on the tongue towards the finish.  A nice toffee and honey mixture adds a moderate dose of sweetness while the grassy hops add a soft bite on the back end.  Comparing apples to apples, or pale lagers to pale lagers, this is actual one of the better ones I have had.

Bottle, Market Street in McKinney, TX.
Pours a straw yellow with minimal head retention. Aroma of slight malt with slight citris. Flavor is the same. High carbonation with light mouth feel......It’s not a bad beer, this is the way I would want our Macro’s to taste like for $5.60 a six pack.

Basic lager yellow with initially large frothy head that turn into a very thin covering. Large champagne-like bubble rise from the depths. Nose of grain, lemon and grassy hops. Flavor was crisp light hops, grains and mild tartness. Rich carbonation made this even lighter. Really pretty nice lawnmower beer.

Bottle. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma is clean malt and light hops. Light body. Flavor has grain, grass, and light hops. I’m not gonna lie I was expecting this to be awful, but it wasn’t that bad.

600 ml tissue wrapped bottle from Country Club Liquors; Nose of caramel and very light grassy hops; medium dark gold with a medium white head; flavor is lagerish grainy, but has some caramel and a light bitter note; I could drink this again, no skunkiness; must have got a fresh one!
smell was hoppy. appearance was clear gold, clean looking. Flavor tasted like a heineken or a becks. Mouthfeel was crisp. Nothing special, I wasnt really impressed.

A light golden beer, pours with a lot of dirty white foam. Nice hoppy aroma with a little malt. Hardly any bubbling. Flavor is of rice malt, and is slightly bitter. It’s just a little sweet but not too much. Watery mouthfeel, but decent bite. An ok beer.

600ml Bottle - The Liquor Collection - Honolulu, Hawaii 

Aroma – Smelled skunked from the time it was open until it was drank.  Very stale and light struck.  

Appearance – Light golden yellow color, decent fluffy head and clear. 

Flavor – A typical over brewed malt beer with very little flavor and very skunked in the flavor also.   
 
Palate – Slick pale Mouthfeel, some texture with a bland dry finish. 

Overall – Had to try it so I can add it to I have tried them all list.  It was pretty nasty actually a very poor beer in my humble opinion.
Well I cannot really say that I expected too much.  Smell is not good.  Looked ok at first but faded at the end. Taste is weak and typical of a pale lager.

Tasted 3/13/08.  20oz bottle.  Filtered with a deep golden hue.  Grainy bready nose.  Light to medium bodied and grainy.  Slightly sweet aromas.  Grainy and tart.  Mild skunk and effervescence.  Still moderate.
Bottled.  Average but certainly drinkable.  No bad comments but it just looked, smelled and tasted like most mass-produced pale lagers.

This is a pretty mild lager but well balanced and drinkable.  It is another in that long line of beers that is so easy to drink that the alcohol sneaks up on you and turns you into an enebriated jackass.  Kudos to Harbin.

From bottle : Pours a clear light gold, with a big two finger white head that slowly starts to fall.  Lots of bubbles and carbonation.  The nose is horrible to me, and i can smell it from a few feet away...its making me want to gag.  Lots of corn syrup, grass, and just a overall grossness that i cant stand.  The taste, while not great, is a big step up from the smell.  Lemons, grass, a tiny bit of hop bitterness toward the end.  Thin, very carbonated mouthfull. Grassy aftertaste.  Atleast its my first China rating.

got to admit, the packaging caught the eye. probably should have looked a little closer, would have seen the green bottle, which i normally shy away from. bright yellow gold with a small unlasting head. lemon grass aroma and inevitably corn. thin spritzy body. slightly sweet grassy flavor with a light spicy lemon hop bitterness. somewhat decent for what it is, and atleast it looks pretty.
First and only Chinese, would say this is probably like a Chinese Bud, wasn’t great, but not to bad. Would have it again when it’s the only beer in a Chinese place.

Sorry, didn’t like this.  Not a big fan of Asian beers in general, but this is a below average for a Chinese lager.  Fizzy, pale yellow color.  Vegetably taste, with what seemed to be some off-flavors. Had a bitter aftertaste, and not in a good way.  Have something else with Chinese food.

Bottle from Limerick Beer and Wine.  Pale gold pour, with ricey malt, slight hopcitrus in the nose.  Watery palate, with pale malty flavor, mild honey sweetness, and some hops.  Nothing terribly offensive here, but nothing to ramp up the score any higher either.
Just another Chinese, lager beer, without much to tell about it, only a little bitter.

600 ml. green bottle, with a white foam overwrap. Freshness date on back label. Poured out a bright, clear yellow, with a minimal white head. Aromas are of rice, grains, slight hops, lager yeast.
Flavors are of rice, yeast, some hops. Thin body & mouthfeel. Not completely offensive, but not great either. Tastes like regular old Budweiser to me.
Gold with a white head. Hop and biscuity malt aroma. Taste is spicy and slightly citric. Hoppy finish. Too gassy to be enjoyable.

The bottle tricked me, I thought this might be decent but in my quick overview I didnt notice the imported from China part (are there any good chinese beers?).  Pours gold, smells like rancid hops.  Tastes a little bitter but not much else in the flavor category.  Its best to just not drink this one.

Bottle. Pours clear gold, with a decent amount of fluffy carbonated head. Skunky corn and malts in the nose. Stingy malts and corn, flavor-wise. Drinkable, but that’s only if you’re desperate for a buzz.

This beer went down with very little flavor. Had a sweet corn taste but it didn’t do anything for me I was expecting more from it especially because of the cool wrap thing around the bottle. Drink it if you have nothing else to drink!
Copying from tasting notes. Bottle. Yellow pour with a small head.  Light in flavor. kinf od like bud. Enough said.
Very pale yelollow color, noe head. very sweet nose. Sweet corn taste. Come on - what else do I have to write about it to fullfill the character limit- geeze
Bottle. Pours clear white yellow, white head. Aroma is skunk and malt. Flavor is the same. Pretty skunky, but at least it doesn’t taste like corn syrup.

600 ml bottle from Bevmo. Pours a pale yellow straw color with a small white head. The aroma is weak with lagered rice and grassy yeast. The flavor is bland and sweet and not much else. Mouthfeel is thin and watery. Overall: This is one poor excuse for a beer, I don’t imagine that I’ll be drinking it again unless I’m in China and there is no tea available. Not recommended.
Aroma is very skunky.  Watery, and the  taste is a bit off..................

THOUGHTS: Not very good, but pretty nice for a pale lager. It had a little more sourness than most pale lagers. That cut down on the metallic finish may of them have.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a clear, medium yellow with nice carbonation and a small white head that mostly diminished and left no lacing. The aroma was metallic with moderate malt and lots of grassy hops. The initial flavor was lightly sweet, while the finish was moderately sweet and bitter and sour. The flavor was malt then metallic hops. The light to medium body was like watery syrup with fizzy carbonation and a metallic finish.
11.2 oz bottle. Pours an uninviting clear, yellow-golden body. Aroma is skunk. Taste is same

expected this to be another watery, non-event like many of it’s counterparts (tsigtao being the first offender that springs to mind) but somehow it offered a bit more. crisp and fresh, grains and grass. not much flavour but not too offensive either
Bottle at home ...Pale golden yellow ... sweet fruity hop ... touch of lager hop but quite bland and easy drinking. Ive had worse lagers.
Cool bottle. Clear yellow, moderate head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is grain, rice, a hint of hops with an unnatural kick. Light bodied, moderate to low sweetness, watery, etc.

Very fancy packaging! Pours a clear bright gold with a generous frothy white head leaving some early lace. Leafy, herby, skunky hop aroma. Clean grainy palate, lightly hopped, clean dry finish. I actually really enjoyed this.

Bottle. Pale yellow beer with a thin frothy white head. Nose is biscuity malts, with a touch of sourness that isn’t particularly pleasant. Very mild flavor, light touch of pilsener malts. Not as bad as some macro pale lagers.

From 11.2 oz bottle into my trusty pint glass- poured transparent thin golden yellow, slowly dissolving head.  Aroma of yeast and malts.  Hits the mouth with a thin watery body, clean and collapseable finish.  Not the greatest drinking beer, but it’s light years ahead of tsingtao.

The beer pours a luminous gold color, the head average and a creamy white, as it quickly settles, the lace forms a thin coating upon the glass, nose is all malt, lightly sweet and crisp, start has a fair malt profile with the top light to moderate in feel. Finish has a customary acidity, the hops barely there, dry aftertaste, drinkable but just barely.
The most remarkable aspect of this beer is the crystal clear yellow color.  The taste is clean and crisp but lacks flavor.  There is no  observable head

600ml bottle.  Interesting packaging.  It had me thinking someone put Sake in the beer section.  Pours a pale yellow with a decently fluffy white head.  This beer has a light, grassy aroma with a bit of yeast.  Upon tasting, this brew isn’t all that bad.  It has a fairly clean, grainy, rice flavor with a touch of grass(green bottle.)  If the beer warms, you can see a bit of malt - almost like a light corn syrup flavor.  As the beer sits in a pint, it seems to go flat pronto.  All in all, an average but drinkable brew.

600ml bottle. Interesting packing. Botle labeled 20070601. Poured a medium and clear golden color with an averaged sized white head. Aromas of grains, corn, and a light grassiness. Tastes of some malty sweetness, corn and grainy. Thin body.
Similar to Budweiser. Just a hint of skunkyness (green bottle - hi, this is 2007, have we met?). Almost no flavor, and zeroz palate. Watery and, uh.. not very good..
Pleasantly surprised by this yellow peril, I was.  Quite sweet and smooth, and a good carbonation.  A good accompaniment to my excellent cooking - in this case, Singapore rice vermicelli.

33 cl bottle from Plaza Liquor - Pours a crystal clear light golden color with a large two finger thick white head.  Very, very light fine bubbled carbonation.  Decent lacing.  Aroma is herbal hops, light grain, and dust.  Flavor is sweet grain.  Light to medium body.  I’ve had better, I’ve had worse.  Worth a try.

Oct, 2007600ml bottle from Morrisons. Clean. Bland. Some cereal sweetness. Modest hops. Quite watery flavour. Nothing offensive here - other than the lack of character or quality. [1.0]
Oct, 2008 600ml bottle from Morrisons in an attractive tissue paper sleeve. Sweet with few hops and some rice notes. Drinkable, but a 600ml bottle is rather a lot. [2.0]

Nice pkg. This one pours a dingy golden color with a tall lasting froth. Decent residual lacing. Aromas of mildly hopped malts. Medium nectar with ample residual effers. This is your average pale lager with no offensive nuances. Dry and malty with a balancing hop profile. The finish is bittered well with citrus rind.

I had to try this since the Russian half of my family is from Harbin.  Anyway, it is hardly great, as expected, but it is really pretty good.  It is golden, kind of fizzy, with a thin, fizzy white head that disspitaes soon to leave a thin foamy ring around the glass but this lasts.  The aroma of grass and nutty grain (perhaps corn?) is prominent.  The taste is similar - grassy grain, nuts, maybe corn, and sweet with a little, very faint, citrusy bite at the end.  It is fairly flavourful and the final grain taste lingers smoothly on the mouth.  It is amazingly full on the palate.  Good, very drinkable, and satisfying for what it is, it is also very good with food.
bottle.  average white quickly dissapating head into clear semi-sparkling straw colored body.  aroma is quite simple with some floral hops.  okay lager with decently long lasting finish.
ah so japanese restaurant, yuma, az / a stronger lager: reminded me a little bit of orion; more mouthfeel than other lagers; nothing original...
Easy to drink and pretty smooth.  Have to be careful pouring it though because the head will overflow the glass very quickly. Not a bad beer if you want to drink a few.

Aroma is strong, typical of a lager - malty and with a bite - but better than most lagers I have tried. Color is a typical lager yellow with a fairly thick and not persistent white head. Flavor is malty and rich, with hints of hop flavor and bitterness, as well as a good alcohol zing. This lager seems to fill the mouth as few lagers, especially American macro-brews, do.

These ratings are in comparison to other lagers.
Bottle.  Pours a golden piss color with little head.  Aroma is strong and skunklike.  Tastes like water with a touch of water.  The palate is smooth and refreshing just like a glass of water.
Cool bottle wrapped in soy paper. Not a big fan of lagers but this one is not bad. One of the better asian beers that i have had, goes well with chineese food.

Picking an Asian beer is like Russian Roulette for me.  If its a bad beer, its REALLY bad.  If its good, well, at least you didn’t get shot in the face.  Harbin falls into the second category.  It has a little of the Heineken/St. Pauli Girl aftertaste, but other than that, its a very average but drinkable session beer.  It IS the Asian Budweiser.  If it were music, it would be some Chinese equivalent to Hootie and the Blowfish.

11.2 fl oz.  bottle.  Aroma is funky with a light sugar note with a somewhat of a grain scent intermingled.  Pours an almost water light golden with a fluffy white head that lingers around for quite a while.  Taste is a little bit of rice adjunct taste, a lightly sweet overtone.  Very non-offensive and smooth but nothing really exciting about this brew either.  Palate is everso lightly bitter and finishes clean and cristal clear.  Overall, it’s a clean and crisp lager.   It’s decent pale lager wise.

Pours an expected clear straw gold. Nose right from the open was with a touch of sweet, but it quickly faded to basically nothing. Flavor is more of what you’d expect. Mild and smooth, though there is a touch of slight sweet to it and a fresh taste. Mouthfeel is standard. Drinkability is high since it is so light and goes down easy. For the price, not really worth it. Might as well drink a Tsing Tao. Overall, it’s beer. Nothing to run out and try. (I can see how AB would be affiliated with this brewery)

Not the worse lager out there.  Yellow color, chemical aroma and chemical flavor with just a touch of malt.  Fortunately the formaldehyde is not present in the aroma or flavor.  
Earlier Rating: 9/24/2006 Total Score: 1.7
Not a bad pale lager.  Very light color, almost no aroma and thin palate.  A little sweet and some malt.  I could drink this on a hot day.

(bottle, Thanks Brewfiend) Pours a clear gold with a white head.  Aroma is skunky and not pleasant by any means.  The taste is also awful with mainly grain and metal, with a finish that wouldn’t subside, and was only eliminated with the help of some water.  A foul creation.
pours a darker golden than I would have expected.  Smells like an american macro like but not skunky.  mild flavor, watery palette.  Not bad.  I just hope it doesn’t contain any lead :-)

Deep golden colour, very thin white head. The nose is dominated by grainy adjuncts, this is also found on the palate. The finish is quite sweet....a bog standard mass produced style of lager. Repeat buy?...Hmmm...dont think so!
Got this one from a friend who works for the local Anheuser Busch distributor. He said I’d love it since I like imported beers. I didn’t.

Pours a pale yellow, pretty much on par with standard american lagers.  Smells a bit like any other basic lager you’ve had, with a touch of Heinken skunkiness mixed in for good measure.  Flavor is very much straightforward, a a bit of rice anda  touch of hops at the end.  Very thin and watery body.  Relatively bland, but quite refreshing and overall inoffensive.

pours a clear light yellow with little to no head.
smells like a heineken, very faint, grain.
taste is carbinated, light, thin, and a little tangy.
just an average beer, taste like a heineken but not as good.

Bottle 330 ml 
Appearance :Good deep golden looking lager with medium white top.3+ 

Nose :Sweet full of pale malt character aroma with light ester like touch
Flavour/Palate: 
Medium bodied, with medium high carbonation. Fairly clean but flavour and overall character felt washed out. Plenty of juice but little flavour. Alcohol with low exposure. Fairly clean brew. Notch above better than most local macros.

Came in a bag.  It  poured yellow with a very mall white head.  Nose was mild and malty, and mouthfeel very thin and light.  Flavor  was very mild as well.   No finish...more like tap-water.    Drinkable, but that is all.
Bottle at PF Changs - Sort of what you’d expect.   A light, fizzy, adjunct flavored beer with moderate head.  Good with spicy chinese food.
12 oz bottle.  Pours light golden with a small white head.  Honey and bready nose.  Pretty dry, with a bit of "tanniny flavor.  bitter after taste that lingers a bit.  Not bad, but not good.

My first beer from China (and I doubt I have many more).  Pours clear yellow with a large white head.  The aroma has pale malt, skunk and corn - mmm, mmm.  Medium body that is oddly slick and overly carbonated.  The taste starts with pale malt with adjunct corn tastes - fairly bland, but what is there is not pleasant.  The finish has some skunk and is on the papery side along with being lightly medicinal.  Fair at best.

A pale lager with a thick creamy white head, which receedes quickly. A perfumey corn adjunct aroma, grainy. In mouth, a crisp malt with corn, no hops, however, rather refreshing. Bought at CJs, Potsdam, NY.

Golden and started off quite promising with a reasonable amount of flavour. There wasa combination of sweetness and dryness. Unbelievably this dissaperared in minutes and this became yet another boring lager. Perhaps A.B are worried about making a beer with flavour!
Bottle from BevMo. Pours a light golden color. Grainy aroma with some creamed corn in there. Flavor is grainy and bitter. Somewhat watery. Not a very good beer.
Color is clear golden with a large white frothy head. Aroma is a bit skunky and bready.  Light grain flavor and a bit metallic. Light bodied with carbonation typical of the style.
Light nose, pale gold color, foamy head. Fast dissappating head. Light creamy malt with a dainty hop bitter. Not really bad, but not good either. Sweeter than bitter.

Nice light honey skunk-hop smell....some head on the pour but dissipates to just a white ring....the taste is like a stella/heineken mix but a tad more subdued....actually quite nice and refreshing!....a surprise seeing as the other 2 chinese lagers weren’t so great, and the price was good too. worth a try if you like pale lagers!

Judged as a standard american lager.  Sweet/sour malt forward with very low hop character, some corniness.  If you serve in a VERY big glass you will get some caramel notes, but hard to pick up any other way.  Totally clear, yellow, low retention white head.  Super clean flavor has sweetness, low bittering, light corniness, possibly rice and slightly detectable hoppiness.  Very watery, but not watered down (hope you can understand that).  Definitely better than the first bottle I had.  Texture is super light, from bittering to carbonation texture.  Too light for style, but felt texture was good vs. flavor.  Did not get metallic tones others had noticed.  Overall, glad I tried this beer again.  Not a great beer, but I remember really despizing it the first time around.  There’s more complexity than I remember, and I have to give these guys credit for some of the best packaging I’ve seen.

Bottle. Pale golden colour with a thin white head. Bready aroma. Some sweetness and corn in the taste. Not much body. Bit of a nothing, inoffensive enough beer - which of course makes it a superior chinese beer.
Nothing special, and overpriced. Nice looking body, decent, not exeptional aroma, bland, run of the mill flavor.

Faint yellow colored body.  White head clings around the edges of the liquid.  The stench of recently dead skunk greets my nose, making me fear the upcoming sip.  Sweet, honey malt taste with lots of metallic overtones and a hint of skunk.

Bottle in HK. Pours yellow with thin foam head. Not much aroma other than a hint of apples and a trace of sulfur smell. Taste is a little sweet, corn and other adjuncts. Oily and fizzy mouthfeel. Aftertaste is rotten vegetable and metal. Nothing special.
Bottle (from Sainsburys). Mild unpleasant flavours which are only on the verge of being noticed served cold. Not much to recommend but not a complete loss.

Clear yellow appearance with a large, white head and a fair amount of lacing.  Fresh straw aroma before the adjuncts take over.  Sweet malt taste, modestly hopped (where do they find fresh hops in China?), with corn syrup and vegetal flavors.  Clean, crisp finish.  Attractively packaged, but still, sort of like travelling to Beijing and eating at McDonalds.
600ml bottle from Sainsburys - 4.8% ABV Dark straw with a loose fomay white head; grassy aroma; sweet corny taste; rather incipid ricey finish. Probably tastes better even colder.

That explains everything for I wondered why a beer from China would be at my little bottle shop in La Porte...it is an A-B product! Clean with a lasting head and surprisingly good lace on my pint glass. After that is was nothing more than your basic pale lager, corny and pale malt driven with just a hint of grassy hops. That said, OhioDad has it right, it is strange that a China lager is better than it’s own flagship beer.
Bottle Sainsburys. A nice clear golden colour. Starts sweet then has a touch of bitter at the end. Not much of a aroma. I though it was not that bad as other comments..
bottle at resteraunt.  clear golden.  big foam head.  light pils aroma.  light and sour with hint of lemon.  Fairly poor quality.
Bottle.  Aroma is a little funky, but reminds of czech beer.  Flavor is mediocre, but the beer on a whole is refreshing.

Bottle; poured an opaque gold.  Aroma was skunky; with corn, floral and some malt.  Good mouthfeel and palate.  Flavor was of some corn, some hops, some malt, and corn.  Refreshing; above average for the style.

One of the best Chinese beers. Far and away better than Tsingtao, Kingway or Pearl River. Mild taste, lightly sweet, but mostly just very watery. But surprisingly lacks the skunk-ee-ness of other Chinese beers (see: Tsingtao) and also lacks the offensive acrid aftertaste

Anaemic, lifeless gold. Halo of white. Sweet, slightly grassy snout. Inoffensive ricewater with a delicately bready/nutty malt ’character’. So slight it’s not even there. Severely lacking in presence or body. Fitting it should be distributed in Europe by the makers of Bud.

Bottle poured golden with a short white head.  Aromas of rice, corn, and a touch of grassy hops.  Flavor is just about that.. Corn, some rice, maybe a touch of honey and grain.  Finish is lingeringly sweet.  Odd that AB makes better beer in china than they do in their own country..  I will put this a touch above budweiser but it really isn’t that good..
Eh. Ok, I suppose, compared to Bud Light. Clear gold in color, quarter-inch white head. Sweet corn and malt aroma, maybe a bit skunky. Thin bodied, thin sweet flavor. Not much to recommend.
Clean light orange body.  A little skunk, slightly sweet and fruity aromas.  Very light flavor, pleasant aftertaste.  Reminds me of a light Henekien.  Better than Bud.
huge skunk aroma.  pale gold with a large foamy white head.  very pale and quite tasteless.  hint of grainy malt and very light hops.  fizzy mouthfeel.
Clear golden pour with lots of head.  Not a lot of flavor.  No real finish, not much of anything.

Bottle.  Pours sparkling gold with a spare frothy white head, mostly diminishing, spare lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (grain, meal, straw), light hops (grass), and average yeast (sweat).  Light bodied, thin texture, average carbonation and a metallic finish.  Light sweetness, acidity and bitterness.

From a twelve ounce bottle purchased at the "Western Hills Plaza Kroger’s" on Glenway Avenue in Cincinnati, Ohio -  This is a Chinese version of an American macrolager - a tad better, but stil crap. What is it with most Asian beers, anyway?

I shoulda known this was AB.  Oh well, at least I only bought 1 bottle.  Very pale looking and very watery tasting.  Bit of nice hoppy aroma, and just a bit of the hops in the palate, but nothing more to write about.  No off tastes anyway.

Pours copper wih a thin white head and sparse carbonation.  Smells of earthy hops, pepper, perfume, light apple.  Tastes of rice, pepper, some sweet malt.  While watery and inoffensive, there’s nothing off in this beer and everything’s well balanced.  Something I’d drink again with very spicy food to cleanse my palate.  Not great, but worth the $1.79 price tag for the 600ml bottle.
Very nice head when poured but disipated very quickly.  Nice color.  Very mild and not really much of an after taste.  It’s okay.
Very plain.  Not offensive at all, but nothing to it really.  Mild bitterness, light taste, not much of an aroma..
Pours a weak clear yellow with a soapy white head that disappears quickly.  Aroma is weak and skunky.  Taste is weak-sort of a watered down Rolling Rock.  Worst beer I’ve had in some time.

this is apparently budweiser’s foray into the chinese market - it’s really not too bad - a bit of skunk and rice in the aroma, but despite the thin body it’s not offensive in any way.  the skunky aroma isn’t apparent in the flavor, thankfully, so it tastes a bit better than i expected after smelling it.  as far as widely-available chinese lagers go, i’ll stick to tsingtao.
Light Gold with White Head.  Rice Aroma.  Bit of the Skunk as Well.  Rice, Light Grainy Malt...Very Light in All Means.. Perhaps a Good Brew for the Extreme Heat Days or with Sushi.

bottle - Pours pale gold with a thin head and a bubbly body.  It smells of rice and malt.  There’s not much flavor to this one at all.  It has the dryness of the typical Asian pale lager and just very little there.  Inoffensive I guess?  That’s about all I can say for it.  Not good.
Bottle. Poured a pale yellow color like a Budweiser with a white head. Tastes  of sour grain and is lighly bitter. Nothing amazing here.
Clear, golden, with fair head.  Insipid grain and grass flavor with skunky finish. A nice complement to Budweiser.
Bottle. Dry lager aroma. Crystal clear gold. Decent sized snow white head. No lace. Moderately sweet for a lager and softly carbonated. Kind of blah. No bite. Creamy texture. Ok, not bad, not great.
very skunky, expected much worse, has a clean bite to it, easy to drink, not what i expected

Bottle picked up from the Dodgy Deli on the Cowley Road, Oxford 09-02-07. I’m hoping that this is the right beer as my one was stated at 4.8%? Anyway Poured a pale golden colour, clear with plenty of carbonation. Was a bit sweet, bit thin and tasting of not a lot about what I expected really.
quickly dissapating head with a golden transparent color.  a sour malt flavor with little hops.  very weak beer.  not good

Pours pale yellow/bold, with a white head. Aroma is skunky, with grain and grass. Flavor is sweet grain and malt, with some grass and hops. For what it is, it’s not bad. An easy drinking, fairly unoffensive pale lager.
This was an okay beer, but not any different from cheaper domestic beers.  Not a bad beer though.

Bottle 12 oz from Wild Oats, Cincinnati. Poured clear light amber with large white head that diminished slowly with good lacing. Heavy grassy aroma. Light body  with little texture. Small light bitter flavor with little grassy finish ofr short duration. Below average brew.
It’s a lager.  That’s about the only positive thing I can say about this beer.  Otherwise, it’s a standard lager.  Nothing special at all.

An aroma of stale corn wrapped in wet paper. A nice clear golden pour. An initial sweetness followed by a sourish bitter. A fizzy, thin palate that lends to make this a not so good beer. Not terrible but it’s damn close. If it tasted as good as it looked instead of tasting as bad as it smelled it would be a good beer. Not a pale lager fan but this one just isn’t very good.

Harbin; green 11.2 oz green bottle with a nice green foil cover over the lid, very classy looking. Label is nifty looking and higher class.  I am anticipating a typical pale yellow american style lager. Pop the lid to get an initial skunky veggie aroma. Pour is typical of a pale yellow american lager and the a aroma now fades to a yeasty beery smell. Very good and well behaved on the beginning taste bud experience but as you continue to drink it has more of a bite.  There is a hoppy bitterness in there that makes its own statement.  It sticks with you continuously. Bubbles continue to rise from within the glass, a good indicator of its carbonation. Though there is a slight bitter bite to it, this is nothing like a pale ale. It definitely has more personality than your typical lager. Beer is OK except for that bitterness on my uvula. Finish is slightly discordant and it hangs on for a few minutes after the lest swallow.  About an average lager in my book, buy a Schmidt’s its much better.
Golden light yellow pour with some nice head and some lacing. A bit astringent in the  overall flavor, but a nice malty aftertaste that went very well with the Chinese meal.  Good bubbles throughout.
Smells kind of like a ricy lager, like say, Bud! Taste is pretty disappointing for me. Ricy and thin, not a winner. Just nothing there.
Bottle.  Fat Cats, Leicester.  Golden with a small head.  Aromas are sweet grain with light fruitiness.  Flavours are fruity with caramel and sweet grain.  Very typical of the style.

Bottle.  The beer pours to a sexy orange golden body with a foamy/frothy white head.  So-so lacing that slides down.  The aroma is crisp, lightly fruity, grainy silage.  Definite lager yeast aroma too.  The flavor is up-front lager yeasts that turn into an aromatic rice and crisp graininess.  Light fruitiness like a pineapple.  This brew would have gone nicely with the vegetable stir-fry I had tonight.  The palate is medium bodied, clean, and fitting.  Easy drinking.

This bottled brew marked 20060513 B1622 from a bottle shop poured a medium sized head of foamy finely sized bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a transparent straw yellow colored body and a good lacing. The aroma was malty and grassy. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of malt hops and grassy. Not one that I would buy again.

Aroma of very light malt and noticable carbonation. Pale gold with a decent tiny bubble white head. Other than carbonation and a very light malty sweetness, there’s not much here. The folks at A-B have got to be proud.

I’m going to get a little zen on you here.  What is the rating for a beer that has no real flavor?  Is it like the sound of one hand clapping?  Perhaps this beer is inspired by such David Caradine, Kung-Fu hoopla.  Pass.
A bit more skunky than expected and definitely not my style.  Almost painful to swallow.
Bottle@Fat Cats, Leicester.  Golden beer with a strong head.  The aroma is light and lagerish, and the flavour is light lager.  Overall a standard lager.

Bottle. Small white head that mostly diminished, no lacing, visible carbonation, transparent, and a yellow hue. Malty and rice nose. Flavor was rice, malty, watery and thin tasting. Unimpressed. Smooth, watery and thin mouthfeel. Light body. Not one that I want more of.
Extra appearance points for presentation packaging. As pale lagers go, it’s average. As Chinese lagers go, it’s tops. Good bittering, light malt, faint hop florals and a crisp finish.

Bottle. Head is initially small, fizzy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), lightly hoppy (herbs), with a light note of DMS. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter, slightly husky. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Not bad.

Pint bottle from Hy-Vee Liquors poured into english pint (just for a change) - Pours a deeper gold than most pale lagers with a 1 finger white head; Skunk to the nose; Almost nothing on the initial taste; A sweet backtaste, kinda like sugar with some yeast thrown in; Thin, watery palate; Way too much carbonation; Only gets a two on appearance because of the bottle; Reminds me a lot of Bud Light/Select with a little more flavor...just a tiny bit though. Finishing this was a bit of a chore. Can’t waste beer though.
This is not a bad beer, it’s 60% in its style, but why go through all the trouble of dressing up the bottle so pretty just to put a below avg. beer in it?

In the bottle at the HyVee Oktoberfest beer tasting in Council Bluffs. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Lots of rice flavor here. Even though it was in a green bottle, it was not skunked at all! Mild and nearly flawless. Semi-boring as no hops appear to be present. Fairly plain beer.
Bottle. Pours light golden with little head. Aroma os grasses, sweetness, and hay. Flavor is surpriningly decent- I must admit I was expecting nothing from this. Hoppy, sweetish, and lightly lemon.
Bottle:  Pours a straw color with a thin white head, light grains and fruits in the aroma, thin bodied with mellow carbonation, starts lightly bitter and ends lightly sweet with a grainy ending.

At Thousand Crane - Cold 11.2 oz bottle:  Pours a clear, deep golden color with a small amount of alabaster bubbles, mostly around the edges. Aroma is of rich malts and aromatic hops with lemon notes.  Taste is of rich malts blended with hops bitterness, caramel, lemon and spice.  Light bodied and smooth with playful carbonation.  Ending is sweet, grainy and effervescent.

500. Thanks, BitBucket Jr.! Can’t beat the ultra-cool packaging. Huge skunky aroma as soon as the cap comes off. Pours somewhere between dark straw and light amber. Lots of surging carb that disappears; so too does the fizzy white head disappear. Skunky in the glass and the light-struck notes carry through to the palate. Some vegetal notes and a whisper of fusel alcohol.

Bottle.  Sour corn/barley malt aroma.  Golden yellow with moderate head.  Very light barley malt flavor but surprisingly more hops in the finish than I would have thought.  Another watery bland lager.

Bottle...pale, pale  golden color...nice thick foam on pour..aroma has much to be desired...just smells like a common beer...only been a few minutes and foam is already dissipating...palate is thin and light...taste is nothing much... a beer; just an ordinary lager...wanted to try it because ive never seen it in Jerzee and the packaging was snazzy...well,  its not undrinkable but this will be my last bottle...(unless of course a friend offers it to me at their house...I wouldn’t want to be rude now)...:)...whoo hoo!  I  made the rating change from 9 to 8!!!
Pale, pale gold.  Smells absolutely AWFUL, rotting corn.  Flavor is light and very fizzy, bit of sweetness.  Smells godawful, looks crappy, but isn’t all that bad.
Ok, if this is "premium" beer then please don’t give me the regular stuff.  This tasted like soap.  Maybe that explains the foam on top.
Horrible. By horrible I mean horrible in all the ways you might expect something like this to be horrible. Skunky, full of adjunct, very watery, very unpleasant. This is bad.
Bottle sampled at the Newtown Brewfest with Stegosaurus and The Mad Indian. Pours yellow with a white  head. Aroma of grain and hops. The flavor is yeasty, rice, and mildly bitter.

Pours light golden and a fully receding white head. Aroma of toasted malt, bread, and rice. Taste is watery, lightly malty, but very flat tasting. Mouthfeel is thin bodied with spritzy carbonation. Not impressed.

Found a bottle of this in Dayton, Ohio, of all places.  Suspect that A-B’s partnership with Harbin will make it more available in the US ... typcial Asian import ... dark yellow with watery, foamy white head.  Sharp corny aroma.  Ricey and shallow, but there’s surprisingly a little bitter edge to it, too.  Not as bad as all that.

330 ml green bottle with apparent brewed on date on back label. Very clear gold color with fast fading white head and pronounced skunky aroma. Light body with lots of carbonation, slight malt and hops flavor detectable, but mostly full mouthfeel from the CO2. Otherwise, no apparent off flavors. Budwesier for the growing masses?

I hope the "Tradition and Culture of China’s most Northern Province of Hellongjian" isn’t as bland and boring as this beer. No flavor, no real smell, and a nice clean straw color. But lacks of any flavor.
I had this beer with A Chinese dinner unlike the food, this beer was non-descript a little watery, it has a nice eye catching bottle and label.

Nothing fancy in the nose.  The presentation in the glass is nice.  The beer, however pale, has nice tiny bubbles and Brussels lace.  Very bland but an uncommonly smooth and dry finish.  Very clean-- perhaps cleaner than any beer needs to be.  Would probably make a decent session beer accompanied by homemade beef jerky and friendly conversation.

Bottle sampled at the Newtown Brewfest. Pours yellow/gold with a white fizzy head. Aroma of yeast, grain, and mild grassy hops. The flavor is grainy and slightly bitter in the finish. Thin body. Crap brew.

Bottle... Clear yellow lager with a large, frothy, white head. Decent retention. Herbal, spicy hop aroma with some subtle biscuity malt. Perfectly balanced flavor, much like seltzer water. Unoffensive. Almost medium-bodied with a spritzy mouthfeel. Short, crisp, clean finish. Thanks to Mark at Virginia Touch for providing the bottle!
I agree with the last post about the chinglish.  Its almost as good as konglish in korea.  I was most impressed by this beers color and not by its taste.  Very rich golden yellow.
Pour is a bright yelow with a small white head.  Aroma is corny and bready.  At least no skunk in mine.  Flavor is spritzy and light.  Pretty bland and boring.

ABC Liquors, Tallahassee, Fl - 11.2 oz bottle. Some expected green bottle skunk in the aroma with some saaz induced hoppiness. Straw colored, too pale of a pour - no head watsoever. Club soda like flavor - hint of graininess. In other words - not much there. Mouthfeel is fizzy, too carbonated. Tastes like a low-carb entry.

Yellow straw color with a taller white head. Light grain and floral hops aromas, think malt liqour light. Very fizzy in activeon the tongue. Some light grain and a touch of rice for sweetness in the front. A touch of lemon grass in the middle. A light minty/herbal finish and linger. A quick and somewhat painless quaff.

Nice label, clear light lager gold.  Green bottle. Very dry, crackery, pilsenerish. Moderate astringency, light body, medium-long bitter finish.  Methinks that this is just another AB market segment move, but it’s not bad if you’re not expecting anything stellar. ABC store.

A classic bottle inscription for connoisseurs of Chinglish: "Harbin Beer since 1900 is the source of Chinese beer industry. It is soaked by Chinese old culture. It has not only the very good taste, but also the old history and rich background. It’s top old brand in China." Lovely stuff. Unlike the beer, which is another of those curiously hop-free Asian lagers. It’s the familiar watery gold and raised an extraordinarily large souffle head that left great reefs of foam down the glass. Dull aroma of rice, salted corn and lemon washing-up liquid. The palate is thin but has a creamy quality like rice starch. The soft mouthfeel is one of the few pluses. Very easy drinking because there is little in the way of flavour to negotiate. It’s mainly watery lemon juice with a sour finish. No obvious malt or hop presence and certainly no bitterness. (640ml bottle from a hawker stall in Little India, Singapore)
This is China’s Treasured Lager, I’m assured by the label. Good to know. Its a lager in a green bottle. It smells like a lager in a green bottle, and it tastes like a lager in a green bottle.

Bottle. Thin foamy head on a straw body. Nose-usual pale lager nose-stale hops, light skunk, dust. Taste-corn, water from a can of canned kernel corn, light lactic sourness, medium CO2, thin, light lotion. Not a great Pale Lager, but not a bad one either.

Oh joy. A lager. Mildly skunky, though no where near some of the Dutch foulness that gets foisted on dumb, Heineken drinking Americans. A hint of tanginess and ctirus notes is about all the flavor your going to get out of this. Harbin’s motto should be: "At least we’re not Tsingtao," because they’ve really got nothing else going on. Not a bad beer to wash down something salty or spicy, but about as exciting as corn flakes for supper.

Didn’t pour as pale as expected, approaching a true gold, a touch of yellow, definitely not straw colored. Fast fizzy head though. Slightly skunked, green bottle. If else, a touch of grass in the nose. The flavor not quite lightstruck, but there was a little sulfury kind of astringency there. Deeper into it, I could notice that the malts weren’t going to come out and play, but they were definitely in the background, providing enough of a mouthfeel to make this start working. Finishing hops also mild, but apparent as a slight spicy grass note. Very clean, and smooth. All flavor elements only slightly above threshold, but given no flaws except for the green bottle, and a delicate balance between those elements, this beer manages to climb just a notch above most mega-lagers. Further, its probably the best Chinese lager I’ve stumbled across so far.
Pours a light golden color with a short lived white head.  The aroma is grainy.  Not much flavor except for a graininess and the finish is thin and watery.

Nice presentation with a cloth sleeve and foil around the neck.  Pale yellow, with a thick white head and lots of carbonation.  Ligh tmalt aroma.  Very light and not much flavor.  While fairly weak, it’s drinkable and better than some other pale lagers.
This was particularly rubbish. Aroma is scunky hopps and sweet lager malts. Taste is sweetish lager malts with some herbal grassy hops which just remind me of miller genuine draught.
Bottle from Slikwily on his return visit. I have this burning question: What makes a lager taste so Funky? Do they all have that skunky,yeast, doughy nastiness?

Actually very nice presentation ( if a little odd with it being wrapped in some fancy clean room hair net thing with a gold bow), and the bottle/label is very cool.
600ml Dark green bottle.
Reasonably nice looking lager, deeper yellow than usual with a nice sized bubbly pure white head.
Aroma ..ohhhh well, I will leave it at the "hairnet" did not stop this beer from getting skunked bad, only other aroma i pick up is a graininess
.\taste while nothing special is better than the aroma, just plain lager here, some fruitiness and a touch of grassy hop.
Rather watery palate.
After all the money  and thought they put into the packaging, i would have liked at least some effrt put into the beer.
Not horrible but far from good.

Never seen a bottle with a hairnet, so they get points for original packaging. Pours solid gold, well carbonated with a generous head. Slightly skunky mild malt and CO2 aroma with hints of floral hops. Rather spritzy and crisp. Not much in the flavor dept. but clean with no detracting adjunct flavors. Has a little malt. A bit stale. A bit sweet. Low bitterness. Not bad.

Big fancy bottle with a gold tie and a silky sleeve. Pours a pale yellow color. Nose of light skunk along with a bit of corn and malt. The flavor has a moderate body (for the style) and a bit of stale hop. Finishes thin and a bit acrid. Typical pale lager I guess.
Aroma of skunkiness, poured with a decent head,  very light color, little to no flavor at all, not really offensive, like some Pale lagers I’ve had, just nothing to it, water has more flavor!

The aroma is metallic with grassy hops and rice malt. The appearance is pale gold with a small head. The flavor is sour, with all the elements from the aroma. The palate is thin. It’s typical Chinese beer.

Clear gold with a very large, lingering head. Virtually no aroma to speak of...slight trace of skunk. Tastes even less than it smells. Now I’m an advocate of pale lagers and think they should be judged more fairly than they tend to be on this site (people seem to rate them as if they expected the taste of a stout or lambic or something, and of course they fall far short), but this stuff is pretty disappointing.
